reviewText: This is a video well put together with tons of information.
There was nothing really bad about it and I learned a lot, but somehow wish it would have been more.
I use this movie to complete my chapter on teaching minerals. It is informative and entertaining, all of my classes seem to enjoy it, even my alternative class .

As always with the Smithsonian it was excelent. I recieve their magazine monthly and I recieve several magazines monthly and I always make sure I finish Smithsonian always. They have great programing and have an exceptional museum. A job well done.
My life is curse, that diamond is just fancy rock...end of story, but a good one at best ?!
Interesting. Learned a lot about the Hope Diamond.

It is a fun video about the mystery and "curse" behind the Hope Diamond and its history.  I show it to my chemistry students for the small amount of chemistry that it discusses with analyzing its composition.  If it had more of the science and more of an explanation about the spectroscopy, it would get 5 stars.
hope diamond is such a mystery this dvd explains a lot

This film followed the history of the Hope diamond starting with the rumors of having a curse on it. Everyone has their own thoughts about it, but it is still fascinating in itself. Personally, I would love to touch it and view it up close at the Smithsonian Institute in Washington, DC but I guess I will have to be content with seeing it in photographs and TV. But it is so very gorgeous, and the sub titles worked, and in the movie, everything that happened with it was explained thoroughly.
Love the story of Americas Crown Jewels.
